abstract.para: Co,parison of arctic grayling growth in fertilized and unfertilized reaches of the Kuparuk river, June-August 1989

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: The Kuparuk river. Control zone, -0.1K to -1.2K; Fertilized zone, 2.0K to 2.6K.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: DATA FILE ENTERED BY: DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: DATE:

para.literalLayout: The response of fish to fertilization was determined by monitoring adult grayling from control and fertilized river reaches. In early July, two fish weirs were constructed in each zone. Adult fish within each section were weighed, measured, tagged and released. In August, tagged fish were recaptured to measure growth of individual fish. Wet weights are in grams, and were taken after holding the fish for 24 hours. Length is total length, using the bottom lobe of the caudal fin.

Notes: After the lower weir in the fertilized section was constructed, many migrating fish were seen trapped below the weir. These were moved above the weir, and it was expected that they would continue upriver and would have to be moved again when they reached the next weir. No fish were sighted piled up below the second weir. This resulted in very different fish densities within our experimental river sections, with almost 5X more fish in the fertilized zone than were in the control zone. On August 3, high rain caused the river to flood and all four weirs were overtopped. Some fish escaped before the weirs were repaired, and final weight and length measurements were not obtained for all fish.
